definition: to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: Position the hose at a downspout drain to discharge then let go of the crimp.
sentences.chinese: 位置处于降排水软管燃放然后放过了卷曲。

sentences.english: Kunlunfaction will let us do the small disciple?
sentences.chinese: 昆仑派会不会放过我们这些小弟子呢？

sentences.english: Be able to be alone. Lose not the advantage of solitude.
sentences.chinese: 要有零丁自处的能力，不要放过孤寂的好处。

sentences.english: To this day, countless cover versions of the song are played in clubs and at parties.
sentences.chinese: 到今天，俱乐部和派对上放过不计其数的翻唱版。

sentences.english: They never ignore any tatters, even an iron piece would bring them crazy joyous.
sentences.chinese: 破布烂衫不放过，碰上铁器喜如狂。

sentences.english: The law prefers to let off for one's past wrongdoings.
sentences.chinese: 法律有时宁愿放过一个人过去的罪行。

sentences.english: Major network operators naturally not miss this rare opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 各大网商自然不会放过这个难得的商机。

sentences.english: Just kidding. I'll let you off the hook.

sentences.chinese: 击球手放过这个投球没打。

sentences.english: But evanescence has never let go of fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 破灭却从不把幻想放过。

sentences.english: We should rectify the undesirable tendencies in time.
sentences.chinese: 不良倾向一冒尖儿就不要放过它。

sentences.english: You way ambition the square novel Ling dictator pass us?
sentences.chinese: 你道方小说陵皇帝会放过我们？

sentences.english: Therefore he that speaketh unjust things cannot be hid, neither shall the chastising judgment pass him by.
sentences.chinese: 执行报复的正义，也决不会将他放过。

sentences.english: Jane fear neither feel easy Zhou Han they would not miss.
sentences.chinese: 珍婶害怕觉得易周汉不会轻易放过她们。

sentences.english: The young reporter muckrakes at every opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的记者不放过揭发贪污腐化现象的任何机会。

sentences.english: Bardo's jealous ear was alive to the slight movement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔多审慎的耳朵是不会放过任何轻微的响动的。

definition: to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to pardon/to excuse/to forgive
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to give up
to release/to set free/to allow (a person or an animal) to go/to liberate
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
lit. start off leniently (idiom); please do not be too strict with me/Do not judge me too harshly./Look favorably on my humble efforts.
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to start/to put one's hand to/to set about/the seat to the right of the main guest
easily/lightly/rashly
to excuse/to forgive/to pardon
to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
to kill/to beat to death
